title: Campaigning for domestic violence services | Sisters Uncut
description: Two women a week are murdered by a current or ex partner in England and Wales. Austerity is making it harder for women to find safety from domestic violence, cuts to benefits are making women poorer which makes it harder for them to leave abusive partners, and a lack of social housing means that women often literally have nowhere to go. Sisters Uncut are a feminist direct-action collective, united by their desire to campaign for better domestic violence services. Three members of Sisters Uncut spoke to Lush's Olivia Graham and explained to her what the collective does and what it aims to achieve.

title: Resisting the prison industrial complex | The Empty Cages Collective
description: Hear from The Empty Cages Collective about their aim to build a movement in England, Wales and Scotland to resist the prison industrial complex movement.

title: The right to love | Condividilove
description: Italian campaign group Condividilove are asking you to support the rights of sex couples all over the world to love and marry each other.

title: Songs of protest | Disabled People Against Cuts
description: Disabled People Against Cuts bring their fight of equal rights for disabled people to the Lush Summit. They refuse to stay silent, and they come armed with songs of protest.

title: A walking tour of love, life and human rights | Queer Tours of London
description: Take a virtual walking tour of London Docks to learn about the LGBTQIA communities’ incredibly rich history of love, life and the battle for human rights.

title: Justice for women of colour | Black Women Rape Action Project
description: The Black Women Rape Action Project prevents the deportation of rape survivors and highlights the discrimination that women of colour face getting justice.

title: Providing for the socially disadvantaged | Artemisszió Foundation
description: Just how do the Artemisszió Foundation from Hungary provide for the unemployed, the Roma, immigrants, and people living in rural areas?

title: Supporting transgender children | The Fundación Daniela
description: A chance to hear from Fundación Daniela, an organisation that is working to end the discrimination that the young transgender children and teenagers can suffer.

title: A woman's place is in the struggle | Radical Women of the East End
description: A woman’s place is in the struggle say Radical Women Of The East End. Here, they tell us why.

title: Indigenous rights in the face of climate change | Eriel Tchekwie Deranger
description: Self-described 'professional rabble rouser' Eriel discusses raising awareness about the negative impacts of the extractive industries on climate, human and indigenous rights.

title: Ending suffering on the Mediterranean sea | Sea Watch
description: The EU should be doing more to end the humanitarian crisis, says Sea Watch. But in the meantime, the group are filling the void themselves. They rescued 5,000 people in 2015.

title: Working together against Aviation Expansion | Airport Watch Europe, Frequent Flyers Levy and Plane Stupid
description: Airport Watch Europe, Frequent Flyers Levy and Plane Stupid ask whether we can continue to fly as much as we do.

title: Defending equal access to the internet | Internet Sans Frontières
description: Internet Sans Frontières discuss their activism work and how they are campaigning to prevent the internet from being transformed into a universal means of repression.

title: The Women's International League for Peace and Freedom | Sheila Triggs
description: Sheila Triggs from The Women's International League for Peace and Freedom discusses preventing war and ensuring that women are represented at all levels in the peace-building process.

title: How to achieve food sovereignty | Global Justice Now
description: Global Justice Now talk food sovereignty: what it is, how is can be achieved, and why it's an idea worth fighting for.

title: How to spot nuclear propaganda | South West Against Nuclear
description: South West Against Nuclear will help you sort myth from fact in relation to nuclear energy and look at the propaganda you've likely already experienced.

title: Problems too big to ignore | No Mad Makers
description: When faced with the feeling that the world had big problems - too big to ignore, but too big to do something about - No Mad Makers refused to do nothing.

title: Putting an end to human trafficking | Stop The Traffik
description: Since 2006, Stop The Traffik has been campaigning against trafficking and raising awareness of the crime. Listen to the group explain their work, and discover what you can do to help.

title: Extreme energy | Frack Off, Biofuel Watch and more
description: Campaigners and activists talk fracking, biofuels and a wave of new extreme energy technologies being rolled out around the world.

title: Tracking surveillance in the Middle East | Bahrain Watch
description: Bahrain Watch has been at the forefront of confronting digital rights threats in the Gulf, so they shared their experiences at the Lush Summit.

title: Indigenous resistance to fossil fuel extract | UK Tar Sands Network and guests
description: UK Tar Sands Network are joined by Indigenous Climate Action and Seed Indigenous Youth Climate Network to discuss the indigenous resistance to climate change and the importance of international solidarity.

title: A minority report for the modern age | Umi Selah
description: In this inspiring speech, made at the #LushSummit, community activist and Dream Defenders mission director Umi Selah, raises important points about racism, minorities and human rights in the modern age.

title: Protecting the USA's last wild buffalo herd | Buffalo Field Campaign
description: Buffalo Field Campaign (BFC) is the only group working both in the field and in the policy arenas to stop the harassment and slaughter of America’s last wild buffalo.

title: Standing against hatred | Clive Stafford Smith
description: Reprieve are human rights defenders. Founder Clive Stafford Smith speaks about key cases and current issues, particularly the plight of democracy campaigner Andy Tsege, who is currently imprisoned in Ethiopia.

title: Satellite-tagging in wildlife crime hotspots | Lawrie Phipps, Birders Against Wildlife Crime
description: Wildlife Crime is any action which contravenes current legislation governing the protection of the UK's wild animals and plants -  illegal bird of prey persecution, for example, which has led to the near extinction of the Hen Harrier as a breeding bird in England. Wildlife crime is one of the UK's great hidden scandals, an under-recorded failing of the authorities to enforce laws that have been passed by Parliament often many decades ago. Charlie Moores helped co-found Birders Against Wildlife Crime (stepping down last year to concentrate on making podcasts for Lush!) and met with one of his former colleagues Lawrie Phipps to talk about BAWC's latest initiative - satellite-tagging birds of prey.

title: Kick Nuclear | Rik Garfit-Mottram
description:
Kick Nuclear is a grassroots group campaigning against nuclear power in the UK.
Charlie Moores meets Kick Nuclear’s Rik Garfit-Mottram, who takes a moment out of campaigning to talk about the cost, danger and waste of nuclear power. He explains energy security, talks about green energy alternatives, and illustrates how power is tied up in business and politics.

title: Soapbox Presents a Q&A with Giacomo Giorgi
description:
"Giacomo Giorgi takes to the Lush Creative Showcase stage to discuss his documentary, On the Wild Side - a film about hunting, and the people working to bring it to an end.

Lush ethics director Hilary Jones asks Giacomo about filmmaking, life as an activist, and what drove him to make the film."

title: Challenging unlawful detention | Freddy Russell, Habeas Corpus Project
description: Fresh from challenging the unlawful detention of individuals, Freddy Russell sits down with Lush’s Charlie Moores, to talk about his work with the Habeas Corpus Project. Much of the organisation’s work involves visiting detainees in a series of detention centres, including Yarl's Wood in Bedfordshire and Colnbrook near Heathrow.

title: CEO Sleepout | Eduardo Goncalves, LACS
description: Homelessness is a reality for too many people, and is statistically only three pay cheques away for everyone else. Eduardo Goncalves, chief executive of the League Against Cruel Sports, joined the CEO sleepout and made a commitment to sleep rough for one night. Eduardo tells Lush’s Charlie Moores how people with power and influence joined the CEO sleepout to throw a spotlight on homelessness.

title: Soapbox Presents Wafa Ben Hassine
description: "Digital rights are human rights. The same rights you have as a human being existing in flesh and bones should exist in bytes and bandwidth." Wafa Ben Hassine from Access Now talks about the frightening reality of internet shutdowns.

title: Inside a Virtual Slaughterhouse | Toni Shephard, Animal Equality UK
description:
How do you show people the reality of what’s going on inside slaughterhouses? By harnessing new technologies. Animal Equality UK’s virtual reality project, iAnimal, transports viewers right inside factory farms and slaughterhouses, which challenges the individual to rethink their views of how 'food' is produced.
Toni Shephard, executive director of Animal Equality UK, talks to Lus's Charlie Moores about the virtual reality project; raising awareness about animal welfare and veganism.

title: Eco spooks | Tracks Investigations Ltd
description:
Armed with a belief in the power of video to change the bigger picture, Track Investigations offers investigative journalism and film production services to conservation, environmental and animal protection groups in order to help spread their messages to a wider audience.
Cofounder and director Gem talks to Charlie Moores about the practicalities of covering such sensitive and controversial topics on projects with organisations such as Greenpeace, Dogs Trust and Friends of the Earth.

title: Helping Brighton's LGBT community | George, Brighton and Hove LGBT Switchboard
description: Charlie Moores talks to George, a counsellor and Health Inclusion Project officer volunteering with Brighton and Hove LGBT Switchboard. They discuss the switchboard’s role in providing services to the LGBT community, and how the charity’s mission to listen, support and inform is put into practice.

title: Working with Refugees on Samos | Pru Waldorf, Calais Action
description:
The refugee crisis is ongoing, and Pru Waldorf of Calais Action, a grassroots giving movement providing support to refugees in Calais and Europe, has witnessed it unfold first-hand. After spending a year at a refugee centre on the Greek island of Samos, Pru sent Lush’s Charlie Moores a number of recordings revealing the highs and lows of her work which he edited and uploaded.
This podcast was produced as part of Gorilla Perfumes Volume 4 - an initiative created by Simon Constantine, the head buyer and perfumer at Lush - after a journey to the Bekaa Valley in Lebanon.

title: Soapbox Presents a Q&A with Amir Amirani
description:
Amir Amirani, director of We Are Many and Maya Evans, a prominent campaigner from Voices for Creative Nonviolence, take a seat on the Lush Creative Showcase stage with Carlene Pickard from Lush North America. 

Amir and Maya are fuelled by the powerful message of the 2003 global march against the war in Iraq. They discuss finding a voice within our democracy, and what it is that will make political leaders sit up and listen.

title: The Fox Project | Sue Williams
description: Spurred on by myths and misconceptions about foxes and their behaviours, husband and wife duo Sue and Trevor Williams set up the Fox Project in 1991 as a wildlife information bureau and humane fox deterrent consultancy dedicated to the protection of the red fox.  25 years on, Sue talks to Charlie Moores about the organisation’s ongoing struggle to improve the public’s perception of the wild animal, as well as their work rescuing, rehabilitating and releasing approximately 700 foxes per year.

title: Ethical Consumer Magazine's Report on the optics industry's support of hunting | Anna Clayton
description:
Ethical Consumer Magazine is a not-for-profit organisation dedicated to helping consumers to shop ethically, campaigners to challenge corporate power, and businesses to improve their supply chain.
In March the magazine released a report on the optics industry’s support and promotion of ‘trophy hunting’. In it companies including Nikon, Swarovski, Leica, and Zeiss, were found to be marketing their products to both conservationists and sports hunters.
Anna Clayton, writer and researcher for the magazine, talks to Lush's Charlie Moores about the ethical implications of the report’s findings.

title: Green Tech and Mobile Workshops | Travelling Toolbox
description:
"Travelling Toolbox does what it says on the tin. A mobile trailer-based workshop, the team delivers training, alongside building equipment for farms, camps and community and educational projects.
Gonzo, one of the founders of Travelling Toolbox, lives on a bus with no mains electricity. He understands more than anyone the need for sustainable technology. A self-confessed Jack of all trades, Gonzo talks to Lush’s Charlie Moores about green technology, and helping projects that couldn’t otherwise afford technology solutions."

title: Soapbox Presents Dr Vandana Shiva
description: Inspired by the bounty of nature, Dr Vandana Shiva discusses her passion for sustainable agriculture, and her involvement with bringing to an end the “age of chemical poisons.” Vandana shares wisdom from her life as an ecological activist, and argues that organic farming and working with the Earth are the way forward.

title: Soapbox Presents a Q&A with Emily James
description: Film director Emily James takes a seat with Lush’s own filmmaker, Erica Edwards. Emily’s film Just Do It is the story behind anti-climate change activism. From legal and financial constraints to hiding film tapes, Emily discusses the difficulties she faced in capturing the stories of the people involved in direct action.

title: Working for whales and dolphins | Margaux Dodds, Marine Connection
description:
For almost 20 years Marine Connection has been working to build a safer and more natural future for the world’s dolphins and whales through collaboration, legislative changes and campaigns.
Charlie Moores talks to the charity’s co-founder Margaux Dodds about the anti-captivity movement, non-human rights and the need for more education on cetaceans.

title: A Soapbox film with Solidarity With Refugees
description: Meet Rosalind Ereira, whose idea of a march in solidarity with refugees grew into something powerful.

title: Soapbox Presents a Q&A with Susi Bascon
description:
"Director of Peace Brigade International (PBI) UK, Susi Bascon, explains the vital role of volunteers, and the organisation’s relationship with Lush.

PBI volunteers provide an international presence to human rights defenders and peace communities across the world. They take a year out of their lives to help others stand up for peace, in places like Communidad de Paz (Peace Community) de San José de Apartadó, Colombia, where Fair Trade organic cocoa butter is produced."

title: Wildlife. Not entertainers. | Alyx Elliott, World Animal Protection
description:
Striving to put an end to animal cruelty, World Animal Protection has rattled the tourist industry with the ‘Wildlife. Not Entertainers’ campaign. Denouncing wildlife activities such as elephant rides, selfies with tigers, and performing dolphins, the animal welfare organisation has been victorious in persuading Trip Advisor to stop selling tickets to many of these attractions.
Fresh from the success of the campaign, Alyx Elliott, the organisation’s Head of Programmes and Campaigns, joins Lush’s Charlie Moores. She talks about that potentially game-changing decision and what the next steps in the campaign will be. (Header image copyright World Animal Protection)

title: The Hunting Act 2004 | Jordi Casamitjana, LACS
description: With the Hunting Act 2004 in place, fox hunting should be a thing of the past - but that’s not the case. While many support this piece of animal welfare legislation as a major step forward, critics want the act repealed. What does the act mean in practice, and what could be done to strengthen the legislation? Charlie Moores asks Jordi Casamitjana, Head of Policy and Research at the League Against Cruel Sports.

title: Marine Connection
description:
"All dolphins and whales should be wild and free.”

Marine Connection are introducing people around the world to the idea of keeping dolphins and whales free from captivity. Born from a desire to make a difference to the lives of dolphins and whales, their work spans across the globe

title: Homeless, but not hopeless | Sally Harvey, AOK Rucksack Appeal
description: Homeless, but not hopeless - that’s the message Sally Harvey’s lays out in this conversation with Lush's Charlie Moores. Sally is the founder and chair of the AOK Rucksack Appeal, a homelessness charity operating in Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole. From providing emergency rucksacks with essential items, to getting homeless people into accommodation, Sally talks about her work with the charity.

title: Clive Stafford Smith: A matter of life and the death penalty
description:
"Clive Stafford Smith OBE has represented over 400 people on death row. When innocent people have been put to death, he’s come back fighting, and enacted changes in the practice that is still in action in many countries across the world. Clive is the founder and director of Reprieve, an organisation defending human rights. He talks to Lush about the problems with the death penalty, and how to influence change.

Warning: this video contains some upsetting scenes."

title: The Fox Project
description: The Fox Project works with over 7,000 foxes a year, helping them get fit and back out in the wild. Founder Sue Williams explains how The Fox Project came about, and why working to protect these misunderstood animals is so rewarding.

title: Badgered To Death | Dominic Dyer
description:
With badger culls in England now looking likely to be expanded beyond the initial cull areas, It's vital to understand our fractious relationship with the UK's largest surviving land predator. Lush’s Charlie Moores gets to the heart of the subject with chief-executive of the Badger Trust, Dominic Dyer.
Dominic discusses his new book, Badgered to Death, and the controversial badger culls that motivated him to put pen to paper.
